newsitem.title: UK: Cederdata shares slide on profits warning.
newsitem.headline: Cederdata shares slide on profits warning.

text.p: Shares in British computer software supplier Cederdata Plc slumped on Friday after the company warned it expected results for the year to be considerably below market expectations.
Cederdata shares slid 90 pence in pre-market trading to 172-1/2 pence, a fall of over 33 percent from Thursday's close.

The company said a number of contracts, especially in the public sector, had been delayed principally due to the impact of the government's private finace initiative and that pricing had become increasingly competitive in the health sector.
Staffing had been geared up to cope with the anticipated new business and the group had therefore operated with a higher level of overheads than in previous years, it said.
Cederdata added it will be taking steps to reduce overheads to a sustainable level.
